cds_std Namespace Reference
New C++11 standard library support

C++11 standard library wrapper namespace. More...

Detailed Description

C++11 standard library wrapper namespace.

libcds needs support from new features defined in C++11 standard library. In case when an old compiler and corresponding std library has no required feature the boost library is used if possible. The cds_std namespace is a wrapper for new C++11 stdlib classes:

  • if the compiler supports new feature, this feature places (with using directive) into cds_std namespace "as is"
  • if not the boost analog is used and it places into cds_std namespace too

For example, for class std::mutex the libcds does the following:

  • for old compiler:
    #include <boost/thread/mutex.hpp>
    namespace cds_std {
    using boost::mutex;
    }

  • for C++11-ready compler:

    #include <mutex>
    namespace cds_std {
    using std::mutex;
    }

    Everywhere in libcds the class cds_std::mutex is used instead of std::mutex.

    Note, not all C++11 features are contained in cds_std but only required by libcds.

    In future when all compilers will be C++11-ready we can transform the libcds to new C++11 standard library changing cds_std namespace to native std.
